definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Chihiro has thus been recognized by everyone to achieve their value.
sentences.chinese: 千尋也因此獲得衆人的認可，實現了自己的價值。

sentences.english: The inclusion of any link to other websites does not imply endorsement by the Nestlé Group.
sentences.chinese: 將其他網站置於連結內不代表雀巢集團對其認可。

sentences.english: Lotus Supercenter has been widely recognized by Shanghai people.
sentences.chinese: 易初蓮花購物中心已經被上海人普遍認可。

sentences.english: It is a new theory universally received.
sentences.chinese: 這是一項得到普遍認可的新理論。

sentences.english: There is no one more deserving of this unprecedented international recognition, " said Clinton.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人比他更能擔得起這種前所未有的國際認可。

sentences.english: The hard fut battle for recognition has been won, but it is by no means over.
sentences.chinese: 這場艱苦的女性能力認可戰雖已打贏，卻遠未終結。

sentences.english: "Compares badly to the mob" is not an endorsement.
sentences.chinese: “比暴徒還要差勁”，這樣是不會被認可的。

sentences.english: All drain traps shall be approved type and manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 所有排水裝置及存水彎的類型及生產廠家應經認可。

sentences.english: The church would not sanction his second marriage.
sentences.chinese: 教會不會認可他的第二次婚姻。

sentences.english: The couple's civil partnership is not legally recognized in Ukraine.
sentences.chinese: 這兩人的民事伴侶關係在烏克蘭不受法律認可。

sentences.english: If you listen to Muzak carefully, you will probably recognize the names of many of the songs.
sentences.chinese: 如果你仔細聽繆扎克，你可能會認可許多歌的名字。

sentences.english: Illustrated under the direction of Robert Kretschmer (1818–1872), they met with wide approval from the educated bourgeoisie.
sentences.chinese: 它們獲得了資產階級教育界的廣泛認可。

sentences.english: GCS is registered and recognized by the IRS as a non-profit organization.
sentences.chinese: 蓋城中文學校是美國國稅局認可之非營利組織。

sentences.english: A friend told me he no longer recognizes his wife.
sentences.chinese: 一個朋友告訴我，他不再認可他的妻子了。

sentences.english: At the court, the Hong approved the prosecution's allegations.
sentences.chinese: 在法庭上，張紅認可了檢方的指控。

sentences.english: I am always unconfident , and lack other's affirm, and can't see the future.
sentences.chinese: 我現在是不自信，缺少別人的認可，永遠看不到希望。

definition: to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
to maintain (that sth is true)/to determine (a fact)/determination (of an amount)/of the firm opinion/to believe firmly/to set one's mind on/to identify with
to attach importance to sth/to value
proof/certificate/identification/testimonial/CL:個|个[ge4]/to prove/to testify/to confirm the truth of
